posts.name: 80807cpr
posts.cooked: team 8087 is trying to configure our wifi hub however it is displaying strange error message

posts.name: Tim Winters
posts.cooked:
Very hard for anyone to understand exactly what problem you’re having without more detail / screenshots, but I will take a guess.

I assume you’re using the FRC network config utility, and you have it hooked up but it says it can’t change the IP to 192.168.1.51 (or something close to that), but doesn’t say why it’s failing.

Our issue was that the application didn’t have permission to edit the Windows network adapter settings. Run the application in administrator mode (right click → Run as Administrator) and it should work
What error messages is it displaying?

posts.name: 80807cpr
posts.cooked: it was displaying that but then the message changed when we tried to run as administrator now it says that it could not locate the bridge

posts.name: 80807cpr
posts.cooked: it is saying that it could not locate the bridge and gives some advice on how to help it however doing those things did not work

posts.name: 80807cpr
posts.cooked: [update] we tried using our Wi-Fi hub from last years robot and it configured properly leading us to believe that we received faulty equipment is anyone else having a problem with faulty new Wi-Fi hubs

posts.name: neev dadhania
posts.cooked:
quoted from wpilib docs:

If you see an error about NPF name, try disabling all adapters other than the one being used to program the radio. If only one adapter is found, the tool should attempt to use that one. See the steps in Disabling Network Adapters for more info.

you can also try to “load firmware” onto the wifi hub to try and start fresh with it.
